title: Penclawdd Walks

images.title: Colin Smith / Pen-clawdd War Memorial
images.caption: Pen-clawdd War Memorial. The village war memorial also commemorates local workers. Behind the row of terraced cottages is the tidal estuary of the Loughor

images.title: Hywel Williams / View towards Pen-clawdd during tidal flooding
images.caption: View towards Pen-clawdd during tidal flooding. A view towards the village during dusk as the unusually high (autumnal) spring tides bring the sea water over the saltmarshes to cover land (and then roads) not normally covered by sea water.

images.title: Colin Smith / Pen-clawdd
images.caption: Pen-clawdd Chapel, cafe and cottages line the street approaching the tidal estuary of the Loughor.

images.title: Dalton's Point from Pen-clawdd by Ian Paterson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dalton's Point from Pen-clawdd

images.title: Pen-clawdd from Dalton's Point by Ian Paterson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pen-clawdd from Dalton's Point

images.title: Saltmarsh at Salthouse Point by Ian Paterson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Saltmarsh at Salthouse Point in Crofty

images.title: Graham Taylor / Llanrhidian
images.caption: Llanrhidian. The Welcome to Town Inn.

description: This Welsh village is located on the north of the Gower Peninsula. The area is great for walking with coastal paths along the Loughor Estuary where you can look out for a wide variety of wading birds. The village is famous for its centuries old cockle industry with the cockles sold all over the world. This walk takes you along a section of the Wales Coast Path to Llanrhidian . On the way there's fine views of the Loughor estuary and the Llanrhidian Marsh. You'll pass Dalton's Point and the village of Crofty which lie just to the west of the settlement. Here you can enjoy fine views from Saltmarsh Point.
